intro: Rhodiola eurycarpa, commonly known as the broad-fruited rhodiola, is a perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent stems and leaves. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its rhizomatous root system allows it to thrive in harsh, alpine environments. Rhodiola eurycarpa is adapted to cold climates and is often found at high altitudes where other plants struggle to survive.
